cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 350 mi NE of the northwestern Bahamas and 460 mi E of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west toward the northwestern Bahamas, then expected to turn WNW across the Florida Peninsula and bend NW–NNW into southern Georgia before veering northeast up the U.S. East Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast (roughly Boca Raton–West Palm Beach area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Bonita Beach to the Ochlockonee River, FL (west coast of Florida including Tampa Bay)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Much of the Florida Peninsula – hurricane conditions possible along the east coast (Boca Raton to Flagler/Volusia), tropical-storm conditions possible along the west coast from Bonita Beach northward including Tampa Bay, and storm-surge areas from Anclote River to Suwannee River
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible at Tampa (34-kt cumulative probability 53%; 50-kt probability 17%) beginning Wednesday night and peaking early Thursday, with gusts potentially 45–55 mph.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of inundation possible in and around Tampa Bay when onshore flow peaks late Wednesday night into Thursday.
weather_observation.rainfall: Rain totals of 3–5 inches with localized amounts up to 7 inches could cause ponding on terminals and minor flash flooding Thursday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and isolated tornadoes in squalls could disrupt waterside and landside operations.
